title._content: Eight soldiers gather with their Jewish chaplain to put finishing touches on giant menorah, circa 1950

description._content: Title: Eight soldiers gather with their Jewish chaplain to put finishing touches on giant menorah, circa 1950 Note: Text on back of photograph: Eight soldiers gather with their Jewish chaplain to put finishing touches on giant menorah for Hanukah celebration at Ft. Eustis, VA. Other Jewish GIs, in other lands celebrate holiday as part of JWB's year-round, world-wide program of religious and morale activities for Jews in uniform. Their duties as guardians of frontier of peace on America's picket line around world give added meaning to their observance of Festival of Freedom. Jewish chaplains, like Lt. Isaac Lubin (center, with hammer), lead khaki congregations in traditional festivities. Photographer: unknown Date: circa 1950 Medium: Black and white photograph Repository: American Jewish Historical Society Parent Collection: National Jewish Welfare Board Records (I-337) Call Number: I-337.B14.F004.0330 Rights Information: No known copyright restrictions; may be subject to third party rights. For more copyright information, click here. See more information about this image and others at CJH Digital Collections. Digital images created by the Gruss Lipper Digital Laboratory at the Center for Jewish History.
